snippet: Two new studies provide clues to how Alzheimer's disease spreads in the brain.
abstract: Two new studies provide clues to how Alzheimer's disease spreads in the brain.
lead_paragraph: The Times reports today on two new studies finding that Alzheimer's disease seems to spread like an infection from brain cell to brain cell -- in mice, at least, and perhaps in humans as well. The finding may help speed the development of new treatments.
